sections.MISSION:
3/2CR Killer Troop conducts Table V Stryker gunnery from 23-25AUG24 at Range 112 IOT certify crews, increase lethality, and prepare the SQDN for future operations.
PL YETI

Training Objectives:
Demonstrate proficiency on ICV-D and ICV-J platform specific gunnery-related skills Pass live fire prerequisite gunnery tables (SGST, TB II, Proficiency) IOT conduct Qualification Tables III – VI. Crews are considered qualified after completing Table VI to standard.

Stryker Gunnery Table V ICV-J
Task: Engage and destroy stationary and moving targets placed in a tactical array, during day
and limited visibility from a stationary or moving vehicle by using full-caliber ammunition
Conditions: Given the following
A fully operational platform with weapon or weapon system.
Allotted ammunition
A certified Vehicle Crew Evaluator
Full-scale or scaled targets to meet the scenario requirements
Standards: The crew must
Score a minimum of 700 of 1000 points overall
Score 70 points or more on all targets presented on seven (7) out of ten (10) engagements
Qualify at least one night engagement
Vehicles line up at ready line behind BP 2.1 Magazine boxes loaded and Wpn System Green
When directed, Vehicle occupies BP 2.1 and goes RED on Wyp System conduct test fire on COAX ONLY
Table 5 DAY indicate day only 2 Defense engagements from BP 2.1 1 offense bounding engagements from FP 1 1 offense bounding engagements from FP 3 2 Defense engagements from BP 3.1
Table 5 NIGHT indicate night only 1 Defense engagements from BP 2.1 1 offense bounding engagements from FP 1 1 offense bounding engagements from FP 2 1 Defense engagements from BP 3.1
Turn electrical safe ON, move to RSO and be cleared off the range AAR conduct at the tower immediately after being cleared off the range
Manning
OIC (E7 or above) x 1
RSO (E6 or above) x 1
Beachmaster x 1
Target Operator/Camera Operator x 1 *RTO x 1
*VCE x 6 *Firefighting detail x 5 (Red Flag Warning;10 PAX)
*CASEVAC Vehicle w/ 68W and driver x 1

Timeline
AMMO DROP: 0400 23AUG24 Ammo will be pre-staged for each truck
Crews will receive ammo and move to be staged on the ready line
At the ready line, crews will load ammo (amber) and await directions from Range Personnel
Crews will move to BP2.1, begin loading ammo (Red) once the previous truck is cleared off range
Once clear, TBL V gunnery iteration will begin
Ammo Plan
Stryker X 162s, Crews 10 X 163s, 1 x OIC, 1 x RSO, 1 x Beachmaster, 1 x Road Guard, 6 x Vehicle Safeties
P – TSM A – FM C – Cell Phone
E – Runner/Flags
